palm something ↔ off.translation[0].defi: to persuade someone to accept or buy something that is not of good quality or is not the thing that they really want
He tried to palm off his old books onto me.
Dealers sometimes palm off fakes as genuine works of art.
palm something ↔ off.translation[1].defi: to persuade someone to accept something, especially by making them think it is better or more valuable than it really is
Some suppliers have tried to palm off cheap telephones or outdated fax machines.
a worthless ring which he palmed off on an unwary buyer
